alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 6:02PM MST until March 16 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arizona... Oak Creek near Sedona affecting Coconino and Yavapai Counties. For the Oak Creek...including Sedona...minor to moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor to moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oak Creek near Sedona. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Stream reaches terrace near Tlaquepaque Bridge. Water reaches edge of several residential and commercial properties near Tlaquepaque Bridge. Low water crossings closed. At 14.0 feet, Flood stage. Several islands downstream in Sedona evacuated. Minor flooding of access roads, buildings, and residences along Oak Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 PM MST Wednesday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage to 15.0 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.1 feet on 02/15/2019. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Oak Creek Sedona 14.0 9.3 Wed 5 pm MST 5.6 4.5 4.2 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz
